Contradict fact: There is no contradictory information or factual errors identified in the provided claim or expert's verdict.
Falters at times: There is no clear indication of the claim faltering at any specific point. The expert's verdict provides additional information and context, but does not point out any significant flaws or inconsistencies in the claim.
